text: Billy Kahora is a Kenyan writer and editor based in Nairobi. He was commended by the 2007 Caine Prize judges for his story Treadmill Love. His stories Urban Zoning and Gorilla’s Apprentice were shortlisted for the prize in 2012 and 2014, respectively. He has written the non-fiction novella The True Story of David Munyakei the screenplay for Soul Boy and co-wrote Nairobi Half Life. As Managing Editor of Kwani Trust, Kahora has edited seven issues of the Kwani? journal. He is a contributing editor to the Chimurenga Chronic. ==Published works== * * ==References== ==Further reading== * Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:Kenyan writers Category:Kenyan male writers Category:Alumni of the University of Edinburgh Category:Rhodes University alumni Category:International Writing Program alumni
title: Billy Kahora
